title: Intuit vs Goldman Sachs vs Wayfair
content:
Education: B.Tech from Tier1 college in CSE
Current Compensation  - 30 LPA
Current Org - Product Based Company
Title - Software Engineer
Experience - 3 YOE

OFFER 1 : 
Company: Intuit
Title/Level: SDE2
Location: Bangalore, India
Fixed Base: ~ 32 LPA(including PF)
Variable Incentive Pay : 4 LPA
Stock bonus: $45K stock grant vested over 4 years
Bonus: Performance-based bonus in terms of stocks
Total Compensation (Salary + Signing Bonus + Variables + Stock) for first year: ~ 45 LPA,
Other Intuit perks and benefits

OFFER2
Organisation -  Goldman Sachs
Title/Level: Associate
Location: Bangalore, India
Fixed Base - 35 LPA(Including PF)
Signing Bonus - 5.5 LPA
Performance Bonus - 7-8 LPA (prorated for this year)
Total Compensation (Salary + Signing Bonus + Bonus): ~ 42-43 LPA,
No other benefits

OFFER3
Organisation -  Wayfair
Title/Level: SDE 2
Location: Bangalore, India
Fixed Base - 42 LPA(Including PF)
Total Compensation (Salary): ~ 42 LPA
Cab, food and other benefits

Needed suggestion from your end which one would be better in terms of work culture,learning wise and WLB ? 
I have to join in few days please suggest as I am really confused.

title: Intuit | senior staff | Bangalore
content:
Education: Tier 2
Years of Experience: 12+
Prior Experience: Indian Product-based
Previous Comp: 80 Lacs All Fixed, Rest Paper money.

Company: Intuit
Title/Level: Senior Staff 
Location: Bengaluru
Salary: 80 L including PF
Relocation/Signing Bonus: 10 L 
Performance Bonus: 16 L 
Stock bonus: 25L / year (4 years)
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 1.21 Cr.

title: Dream11 SDE-2 Offer 2024
content:
Education: Govt. College Delhi
Years of Experience:3
Date of the Offer: Sept, 2024
Company: Dream 11
Title/Level: SDE-2
Location: Mumbai
Salary: 42 lakhs
Relocation/Signing Bonus: 8.4 Lakhs(2 year clawback)
Stock bonus: 15 lakh(10%,20%,30%,40%) vesting
Bonus: NA
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 50.4 for first year + paper money
Benefits: 50% grossed up rent payment on top of salary (max up to 45k) if you live within 1 hour of office
